title: Fix filmstrip thumbnails during extraction (frameImage pass-through)
description:
Filmstrip thumbnails show frame 0 instead of actual swing positions during extraction.

Root cause: SwingFormProcessor.captureCurrentFrame() reads from main video element which is paused at frame 0 during extraction.

Fix: Pass frameImage (ImageData) from PoseExtractor through the pipeline so thumbnails capture the correct frame.

title: Document back safety principle in FormAnalyzer
description: Add key insight about back safety to FormAnalyzer/detector comments: Arms should only move freely when disconnected from body (at lockout). When arms are connected (touching legs/torso), that's when hinging occurs. This ensures zero back strain because load transfers through skeleton, not back muscles.

title: Fix silent failure in switchCamera - add user feedback
Fix failing usePipelineLifecycle tests

title: Speed up user-journey E2E tests
description:
User-journey tests take 1.5-2+ minutes each (15 tests = ~25 min total).

Root causes:
1. Video fetched from GitHub (https://raw.githubusercontent.com/idvorkin-ai-tools/form-analyzer-samples/main/exercises/kettlebell-swing/good/swing-sample.webm)
2. Video length unknown - likely longer than needed for tests
3. Tests wait for full extraction/playback

Potential solutions:
- Create a SHORT test video (2-3 reps, ~5 seconds)
- Host test video locally in repo or serve from dev server
- Use mock/synthetic pose data instead of real video for most tests
- Add test timeout configuration

Current state:
- swing-analyzer tests: 14s (10 tests) - fast because they use fixtures
- user-journey tests: 1.6min+ (20 tests) - slow because they load real video

title: Optimize E2E test performance

notes: Completed: Changed frame delay default from 10ms to 0ms. With 796 frames, this saves ~8s per test that uses mock extraction. Tests pass in isolation; parallel flakiness is tracked separately in swing-mt5.

title: Debug rep counter not updating with cached poses during playback
description:
## Problem
Rep counter doesn't update when video plays with CachedPoseSkeletonTransformer (streaming mode), even though skeleton overlay renders correctly.

## Context
When extraction starts, VideoSection.tsx calls reinitializeWithLiveCache() which creates a new pipeline using CachedPoseSkeletonTransformer instead of the ML-based PoseSkeletonTransformer. The skeleton overlay works (proving cached poses are being read), but rep count stays at 0.

## Key Files to Investigate
- `src/hooks/useSwingAnalyzer.tsx` lines 145-170 - pipeline subscription setup, setRepCount callback
- `src/pipeline/Pipeline.ts` - full pipeline flow: skeleton ‚Üí form ‚Üí rep
- `src/pipeline/CachedPoseSkeletonTransformer.ts` - transforms frames to skeletons using cached data
- `src/pipeline/SwingFormProcessor.ts` - detects swing positions (Top, Connect, Bottom, Release)
- `src/pipeline/SwingRepProcessor.ts` - counts reps based on position sequence
- `src/components/VideoSection.tsx` lines 52-60 - reinitializeWithLiveCache trigger

## Pipeline Flow
1. VideoFrameAcquisition emits FrameEvent (on video play/pause)
2. CachedPoseSkeletonTransformer looks up cached pose ‚Üí emits SkeletonEvent
3. SwingFormProcessor detects position ‚Üí emits FormEvent/checkpoint
4. SwingRepProcessor counts reps ‚Üí emits RepEvent
5. Pipeline.resultSubject pushes to useSwingAnalyzer which calls setRepCount

## Debug Steps
1. Add console.logs in Pipeline.ts to verify skeleton events emit (line 72-75)
2. Check if formProcessor.processFrame receives skeletons (line 84-86)
3. Check if repProcessor.updateRepCount receives checkpoints (line 97-100)
4. Verify setRepCount callback is being called (useSwingAnalyzer.tsx line 150)

## Hypothesis
The issue might be:
- Form processor not detecting positions from cached skeletons
- Pipeline subscriptions not set up correctly after reinitialize
- Skeleton events emitting but form processor filtering them out

title: Add IndexedDB persistence to SessionRecorder for crash recovery
description:
Implemented crash log persistence in IndexedDB:
- Auto-saves session to IndexedDB every 5 seconds
- Keeps last 10 sessions for crash debugging
- Exposed on window.swingDebug for easy console access
- getCrashLogs() - retrieve persisted sessions
- clearCrashLogs() - clear old sessions
- getCurrentSession() - get current session
- downloadSession() - download as JSON

title: Test sync from swing-6 dir
Emit thumbnail events from Pipeline when cycle completes
ImageData objects in PoseExtractor causing high memory usage
description:
During extraction, frameImage (ImageData) is captured for EVERY frame and stored in PoseTrackFrame.frameImage.

For a 5-minute video at 30fps = 9000 ImageData objects
Each ImageData = width √ó height √ó 4 bytes
At 1080p: 1920 √ó 1080 √ó 4 = ~8MB per frame
9000 frames √ó 8MB = 72GB potential memory usage!

Even at lower resolutions this is massive memory consumption.

**Location:** src/services/PoseExtractor.ts:173-176, 201

**Fix options:**
1. Don't store frameImage at all (it's only used for debugging)
2. Only keep frameImage for keyframes (every N frames)
3. Use a circular buffer with fixed size
4. Compress/downsample the images significantly

title: Fix 7 failing E2E tests
description: 4 instant-filmstrip failures (rep counting), 1 swing-analyzer failure (hardcoded video load), 2 user-journey failures (video source blob: vs swing-sample.webm). These existed before our changes.
notes:
Fixed: 
1. Missing `scripts/generate-version.sh` causing 35 test failures (app wouldn't load)
2. Video src tests expecting `swing-sample.webm` but app uses `blob:` URLs (3 tests)
3. Parallel test flakiness - reduced workers from 10 to 4, added `test.describe.serial` to filmstrip tests

All 64 tests now pass (6 skipped).

title: Create model configuration

title: Use z-coordinate to correct angle measurements for off-axis camera
description:
Currently all angle calculations in Skeleton.ts are purely 2D (x,y only). The z-depth from BlazePose is preserved but unused.

Use case: When user isn't perfectly sideways to camera, 2D angles are skewed.

Implementation:
1. Detect body orientation from z-depth (e.g., left_shoulder.z vs right_shoulder.z)
2. Calculate rotation angle: atan2(shoulder_z_diff, shoulder_x_diff)
3. Apply correction factor to 2D measurements: scale by 1/cos(rotation)

This would improve accuracy for users who can't get perfect side-on camera positioning.

Depends on BlazePose integration (swing-joq).

The settings modal has UX issues identified by two frontend reviews:

**Critical Issues:**

3. DebugTab uses emoji icons (üñ•Ô∏è ü§ñ üìπ) instead of SVG icons from Icons.tsx
4. DebugTab has inline styles instead of using the CSS design system

**Medium Issues:**
5. GeneralTab is nearly empty (only Display Mode)
6. Tab organization unclear - Debug mixes settings with tools
7. No route navigation in header (users don't discover /debug, /poses)

**Low Priority:**
8. No toast notifications for setting changes
9. Mobile tab labels could be more helpful

This ensures visual consistency and easier maintenance.

- Remove MoveNet/PoseNet detector code
- Remove COCO-17 keypoint mappings and types
- Remove model selection logic (hardcode BlazePose)

- Update tests to only use BlazePose fixtures

title: Batch rep counting from cached/extracted poses

Currently reps only count during real-time video playback. Add batch mode rep counting:

1. Pre-compute during extraction: As poses are extracted, run rep processor so results are ready when extraction finishes
2. Instant analysis on load: When cached poses load, immediately analyze all frames and show final rep count

This enables instant feedback without waiting for video to play through.

- Skeleton building from frame data
- Frame-by-frame navigation
- Keyboard shortcuts and fullscreen
- Cache reinitialization

This epic tracks breaking it into smaller, testable hooks and adding comprehensive unit tests.

title: Big bang integration of InputSession into VideoSection
Redraw skeleton on manual video seek
description:
## Problem
When user seeks/scrubs to a different position in the video while paused, the skeleton overlay does not redraw for that frame. The canvas remains blank until playback resumes.

## E2E Test Added
- `e2e-tests/user-journey.spec.ts` - "Skeleton Redraw on Seek" test section
- Test confirms bug: `skeleton redraws when video is seeked manually` FAILS
- Canvas has no content after seek while paused

## Root Cause (to investigate)
The `VideoFrameAcquisition` only emits frames when video is playing:
```javascript
this.videoElement.paused ? NEVER : interval(frameInterval)...
```

Need to also emit a frame on the 'seeked' event when paused.

## Files to Fix
- `src/pipeline/VideoFrameAcquisition.ts` - add seeked event handler
- Possibly `src/hooks/useSwingAnalyzer.tsx` - ensure skeleton renders on seek
